intro: Thesium pallidum, commonly known as the pale thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in open habitats with well-drained soils. Thesium pallidum is an herbaceous perennial that produces seed capsules as its fruit. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
